Posts.Content: Sep 11, 2008 09:08AM stefie wrote: I have not been on in a couple of months.  I went on vacation in July to florida and met a really nice guy after losing my husband 6 years ago.  We have been keeping in touch and i plan to go back in nov.  Well last week i finally got my 1 year mamogram and they called me back.  I went yesterday and the radiologist is very worried.  I now have some calcifacation in my right breast, last was on my left.  I am in denial,  I can't believe this is happening.   I mean I really can't.  I told my cousin about it and she called me back today and was worried that I was not taking this seriously.   Well hell what can you say??   I don't want to be realistic for once in my life.  I am totally devsestated.  Please someone tell me your experience with this.  I am on tamox and had radiation.  I just know this is going to be  bad.    stephanie
Posts.Title: Here I go again! Roja1955 Roja1955

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2009 05:51AM stefie wrote: Hi all       I was diagnosed on sept 2007. at the time I was not sure about some of the family history. After a recent death in the family I found out that I have 2 first cousins who have had mastectomies and numerous women on my grandmothers {Paternal} side of the family.  Does this new info matter.  I ask because they only seem to be interested in parents and siblings. I am currently taking tamoxifen and doing just ok with it. Thanks in advance.   Peace to all. stefie
